quiet.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: not making much noise, or making no noise at all
quiet.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: We’ll have to be quiet so as not to wake the baby.
It’s a nice car. The engine’s really quiet.
I’ll be as quiet as a mouse (=very quiet).
quiet.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: not saying much or not saying anything
quiet.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: You’re very quiet, Mom – is anything the matter?
I didn’t know anything about it so I just kept quiet.
a woman whose life of quiet desperation threatens to overwhelm her
quiet.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: someone who is quiet does not usually talk very much
quiet.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: a place that is quiet has no noise or not much noise
quiet.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: Our hotel room was comfortable and quiet.
When they walked into the pub, the place went quiet.
quiet.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: without much activity or without many people
quiet.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: It was a Sunday, about three o'clock, and the streets were quiet.
I’d love to go on holiday somewhere where it’s nice and quiet.
Anthony met her in the bar, and they found a quiet corner where they could talk.
I’m going to have a  quiet night in (=an evening when you stay at home and relax).
He wants a quiet life, while she wants to go out partying.
quiet.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: if business is quiet, there are not many customers
quiet.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: August is a quiet time of year for the retail trade.
quiet.translation[0].note_box[0].section: a quiet sound or voice
not making a loud sound
I heard a quiet voice behind me.
a car with a quiet engine
quiet – especially because you do not want people to hear or be disturbed
Doug was on the phone, speaking in a low voice.
I turned the volume down low.
quiet and pleasant to listen to
Soft music was playing in the background.
His voice was soft and gentle.
silent
not making any sound at all
a silent prayer
silent laughter
The machines were virtually silent.
hushed
deliberately quiet because you do not want people to hear – used about people’s voices
They were talking about money in hushed tones.
The doctor’s voice was hushed and urgent.
faint
quiet and difficult to hear because it comes from a long way away
The men went ahead and their voices got fainter and fainter.
the faint sound of bells
muffled
difficult to hear, for example because the sound comes from another room or someone’s mouth is covered by something
Muffled voices were coming from downstairs.
the muffled sound of someone crying
a dull sound is not loud – used especially about the sound of something hitting another thing
He hit the ground with a dull thud.
inaudible
too quiet to hear
The sound is inaudible to the human ear.
Her answer came in an almost inaudible whisper.
a quiet place
without much noise
It’s so quiet here at night.
This is the quietest room in the house to work in.
silent
with no noise at all
The room fell silent (=became silent).
peaceful
quiet in a pleasant and relaxing way
Life’s more peaceful in the countryside.
The hotel is set in tranquil surroundings.
sleepy
quiet – used about a town or village where there are not many people and very little happens
a sleepy fishing village
not saying much
not saying much
He’s a quiet boy who loves reading.
You’re very quiet tonight, Suzy – are you OK?
silent
not saying anything
Her husband was a big silent man.
Everyone was arguing but I decided to remain silent.
taciturn
not talking much and seeming a little unfriendly or bad-tempered
He found Vaughn a taciturn and rather difficult person.
reticent
unwilling to talk to other people, especially about a particular subject
She’s always been reticent about her early life.
a man/woman of few words
someone who does not talk much, especially because they only speak when there is something important to say
My father was a man of few words, but when he spoke everyone listened.
quiet.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: the state of being quiet, calm, and peaceful
quiet.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: We were enjoying the quiet of the forest.
I’ve had an awful day – now I just want some peace and quiet.
quiet.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: Can I have some quiet, please?
quiet.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: if business, a market etc is quiet, there are not many customers or there is not much activity
quiet.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: August is a quiet time of year for the retail trade.
The market has been quiet this morning.
quiet.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: the right to use property or land without any interference
quiet.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: The purchaser shall have quiet enjoyment of the land.
